lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Death of a Dedicated Ugandan Healer'' (Editorial Notebook, Dec. 25), by Tina Rosenberg: Diseases like Ebola, AIDS and malaria require a military-style, no-holds-barred response. Tragically, the United States and other Western countries are less likely to contribute as much to Africa's medical battles as they did to the cold-war variety.
abstract: Letter from Barbara McNelly on Dec 25 tribute to Dr Matthew Lukwiya, who fought Ebola outbreak in Uganda, says United States and other Western countries are less likely to contribute as much to Africa's medical battles as they did to its cold-war battles
